page.title: 01Upper & Lower Chicksgrove
page.content: Upper and Lower Chicksgrove are hamlets in a farming area which, apart from the coming of the railway, has remained virtually unchanged for hundreds of years. Each settlement is centred round a farm with which the older buildings were once directly connected. Both adjoin the road which runs at a safe distance from the water meadows of the river valley. Only one meadow retains the channels and stone sluices of the flooding system while the weir and sluices on the river are falling into disrepair. Cereals, sheep and store cattle are raised but the undulating nature of the land would probably preclude much further enlargement of fields while the narrow road inhibits industrialisation. With its stone and thatched buildings and ancient hedges, this area is really like an illustration in child's book.
